cyber-dojo.sh:
rm -f *.class
CLASSES=.:`ls /cucumber/*.jar | tr '\n' ':'`
javac -Xlint:unchecked -cp $CLASSES  *.java
if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
  java -cp $CLASSES org.junit.runner.JUnitCore `ls -1 *Test*.class | grep -v '\\$' | sed 's/\(.*\)\..*/\1/'`
fi
hear_shout.feature:
Feature: Hearing a shout

    Shouts have a range of approximately 1000 metres

    #Scenario: In range shout is heard
        #Given "Lucy" is at 0, 0
        #And "Sean" is at 0, 900
        #When "Sean" shouts
        #Then Lucy should hear Sean

      #Scenario: Out of range shout is not heard
        #Given "Lucy" is at 0, 0
        #And "Sean" is at 1800, 800
        #When "Sean" shouts
        #Then Lucy should hear nothing
        
      Scenario Outline: only hear in-range shouts
        Given "Lucy" is at <Lucys-location>
        And "Sean" is at <Seans-location>
        When "Sean" shouts
        Then Lucy should hear <what-Lucy-hears>
        
        Examples: In-range
          | Seans-location | what-Lucy-hears | Lucys-location |
          | 0, 900         | Sean            | 0, 0           |
          | 0, 400         | Sean            | 0, 0           |
          
        Examples: Out of-range
          | Seans-location | what-Lucy-hears | Lucys-location |
          | 900, 900       | nothing         | 0, 0           |
          | 800, 800       | nothing         | 0, 0           |  
        
      #Scenario: Multiple shouters
        #Given "Lucy" is at 0, 0
        #And "Sean" is at 0, 500
        #And "Oscar" is at 1100, 0
        #When "Sean" shouts
        #And "Oscar" shouts
        #Then "Lucy" should not hear "Oscar"
        #But Lucy should hear Sean
        
      Scenario: Multiple shouters
        Given people are located at
          | name  | x     | y     |
          | Lucy  | 0     | 0     |
          | Sean  | 0     | 500   |
          | Oscar | 1100  | 0     |
        When "Sean" shouts
        And "Oscar" shouts
        Then "Lucy" should not hear "Oscar"
        But Lucy should hear Sean  
        
        
      Scenario: Shouters should not hear there own shout
        When "Lucy" shouts
        Then "Lucy" should not hear "Lucy"
